name: jamers
text: Dude was just trying to understand the strip at a deeper level. Far be it from us to shame him about that.

name: zefiel
text: well yes, but his language about it could've been a bit more subdued. Also, Lugosi defined the modern Dracula. (erasing Shrek's more awesome Nosferatu in the process, sadly) Anyway, Wikipedia is just a click away. I'm not even from america, and I get most of the achewood humor.

name: fineoakstructure
text: zefiel - sorry for the grammar nazi tone, but you gotta be careful with that name: it's Max Schrek, with the "c".  Thinking that anything having to do with "Shrek" is awesome is just sacreligious.

name: xiaomimi
text: (Schreck)

name: fineoakstructure
text: Awww fuck.  See, this is why we work as a community (and why I normally don't correct spelling).

name: charchar
text: Trivia Time! Shreck is German for fight or terror and is indeed his given name.

name: charchar
text: God-- for fright not Fight.

name: st-elmos_fire
text: Man now I gotta imagine his parents all grooming him to grow up and become an incarnation of Dracula, all putting tons of make-up on him before he goes sliding off to kindergarten, all telling him that daytime is nighttime so he doesn't get too confused when all that silent film makers can shoot in is daylight.

name: laserblade
text: Nope, it's still spelled "Schreck".

name: jezebel
text: Huh.  Yeah.  I was a little confused.  I thought there was some deeper meaning in a Scottish green ogre that I missed.

name: invidious
text: I'm still waiting for the Shrek vampire movie. Man that would be awesome.

name: tragicone
text: Ahhh, Count Orlok was a different type of vampire than Dracula. Orlok was a nosferatu race and Dracula is probably a Ventrue. Different people broham!

name: fineoakstructure
text: The reason why Count Orlok was different than Dracula was because Bram Stoker's widow, I believe, was going to sue Murnau if he tried to make his vampire movie based too closely on the book.  Anything else is just silly.

name: saint
text: A comment left by saint was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by straw, madnes, mr_lostman28, Gompo, GeyserShitdick, mattylite, Centipede_Damascus)

name: twohundredninety
text: It was probably a different set of people each time -- the people who lamed your comment would probably neither chubby nor lame jamers', and the people who chubbied his would probably neither chubby nor lame yours.

name: choosebro
text:
Cause you're being kind of a dick, while Jamers was being a proper chap.

Anyway, it's your responses that deserve the lames, not the first enquiry.

name: saint
text:
i suppose you're right.
my bad guys.

name: heccibiggs
text: And also wait however long, probably at least a day, until someone did reply. Soooo...

name: snowman
text: The real issue is, they only told you half the story.  The joke here is that Ray's crotch is playing "Bela Lugosi's Dead," a song by early goth band Bauhaus.  Now you know.

name: lechatbotte
text:
Who's Bauhaus?


(Just Kidding!) :>

name: lechatbotte
text: Seriously, I'm old enough to remember them the first time around!

name: rowboat
text: To not know is fine. To ask a bunch of hateful nerds (like me) instead of just googling it is a dangerous game, fraught with peril. And yes, it is lame. I realize that saint may be from, like, Tajikistan, or some place where there's no sunlight, grass or women, let alone a video store. But home boy's got the internets, so asking was just lazy and wrong and he deserves the worst we can give. On the other hand, it should be noted that I didn't lame him. Tajikistanis got enough problems without my low opinions added, you know? He's probably got a truck full of opium and preteen brides-to-be to get across the Afghani border before supper time, so, you know, he's got other things on his mind.

name: saint
text:
you made me laugh, in spite of myself.
HOWEVER, first, I want you to read the post just one above yours. Next, I want you to read the post two before that. Thank you.

And, for the record, they are ALL over the age of 13. Sicko.

name: turnabout
text: The joke here is that the Bauhaus song plays. Look up Bauhaus for more deeper meanings for this strip.

text: I really enjoyed this strip, it sums up Achewood humor for me so well. I'm really surprised it hasn't been rated higher.

name: le_baron_noir
text:
Quote:
"...when your frontman goes, the rest of the band is essentially hosed."

It seems like Teodor would mention something about Joy Division, here. As I see it, New Order are the only exception to the above stated rule, in that they became even better after the loss of Ian Curtis. It seems like Teodor would agree with that.

name: sp1derbaby
text: This is true basically because Bernard Sumner didn't dance.

name: lechatbotte
text: Genesis may also be an example. You either love them before Gabriel left, or after, but few like both. Any rate, Collins gave them more commercial success, which doesn't mean pifle.

name: mattbeetee
text: I used to live next door to Mike Rutherford! He was a nice man, who recycled.

name: tekende
text: I still can't believe you haven't been lamed for this. I'm not saying you should be, mind, you have a right to your opinion, but the idea that New Order is better than Joy Division is not popular. (It is also not an idea I agree with.)

name: le_baron_noir
text:
I like Joy Division a little. But I like dancing a lot. Dancing to Joy Division, while possible, feels really wrong.

This is not to imply that I judge all music on it's danceability. But if I'm choosing between just these two bands my choice will be the same every time.

name: lechatbotte

name: libelandslander
text:
Guess which song came on right as this arc started.

*LE SIGH* it always makes me happy when people make Bauhaus references, because I am having a hard time meeting people who even know who they are, even though I live in basically the coolest city on the planet

name: i_love_kate
text:
I had my first experience with absinthe not three days ago. Just swigged from a tiny bottle, not poured onto a cube of sugar on a spoon or however is traditional. For being 160 proof, it had a surprising lack of kick, and the only hallucinogenic effects that I experienced were a slight jumpiness from loud noises for the next hour or so.

Not really a defining experience in my life, I must say. Hopefully acid will be more enlightening.

name: akadriver
text: Absinthe is all about the ritual and the bloom and the gothic dancing.  Thujone does exactly squat, and most of the Czech mouthwash being purveyed as absinthe doesn't have it anyway.  If you're gonna swig it from a bottle, you might as well just have a nice glass of wine accompanying some sort of sage-based dish (sage containing much more thujone than wormwood).

name: fineoakstructure
text: May I recommend some shrimp and white wine?

name: theguitarhero
text: B-B-BEAVER BOYS! B-b-b-b-beaver boys!
